title: My bookmarks are not opening in the browser when I select the site from the bookmarks bar.
content:
After a recent cookie and unwanted stored browser data clean-up by my antivirus, Total AV (it was one of those pop-ups that recommended that you cleared out your accumilated browser junk, and it would not delete anything important), but since it was completed, I have discovered that when I click on a saved bookmark, the site selected does not open in my browser.

All the bookmarks are still listed, but none have any specific site icons (just the basic globe icon or the Firefox icon).

I hope that my bookmarks are saved somewhere and can be retrieved as I have a Firefox account ‚Äì I believe that is how it works.

I hope that this problem can be resolved easily because I may have lost hundreds of bookmarks that are relevent to my BA, MA and further and currently my PhD. If there isn't an easy fix, it's goodbye to Firefox (I can't risk using unreliable software), and goodbye to Total AV (who are a very modern high-tech organisation in the way that they are totally uncontactable) and no more bucks to either of them from me.
creator: roland.smith

title: SASE Proxy with SSL interception : Can't download plugins.
content:
Hi,

On my corporate environnement, we use Firefox 130.0.1 (64bits) and a SASE Proxy (netskope).

For most of the web activity, the HTTPS trafic is silently intercepted (The Proxy has it's certificate installed as a trusted root CA in Firefox and Windows). It works well.

When trying to install an extention, I get a message saying "Download failed. Please check your connection". in the console I can read : "Ignoring promise rejection during installation: Error: Install failed: onDownloadFailed".

I create a rule excluding https://addons.mozilla.org/ from SSL interception, there's no issue.

It looks like the trusted root CA of the SASE Proxy is ignored.

Like this issue, but I don't have expired certs : https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1258023

Reagards,
creator: ailh.julie

title: I accidentally denied Firefox access to devices on my local network
content:
Hello all

There was a pop-up on my Mac'S Firefox asking if I allow Firefox access to my local network devices. I clicked on 'No' And obviously now I can't access for example my router's webpage or any other webpage fromo any devices on my local network. How I can switch it back? Internet access is working fine.

Many thanks, Bogdan

title: Translation icon missing in menu bar
content: I'm running Firefox 130.0.1 (64-bit) and noticed when I read a foreign-language wikipedia article, I do not get the translation icon in the right end of the menu bar. All I see is the "Toggle reader view" icon and the "Bookmark this page icon." I can't figure out where it went. I saw another thread that asked people to check their General settings and "choose your preferred language for displaying pages" option, but it's already set to English (US).

title: support with webpage difficulty
content:
When I go on eBay the first website page is fine. However when I click on a link to a product I get weird web pages with a heading "breadcrumb" and the page comes out with only a few images and this strange lot of directional arrows. When I paste the webpage address into another webpage exactly the same problem. When I paste the address into Chrome, no problem, the page comes up correctly with all the images and not this weird page I get with Firefox. I prefer to use Firefox and I would really rather not have to change to Chrome or MS Edge.

I didn't always have this problem, it seemed to have been more recently and seems to be only with eBay. I imagine it's something in the settings that somehow switched and I need to switch it back.

Thank you for all those at Mozilla support, I look forward to a reply. My email address is alesich@optusnet.com.au regards, Bert
creator: alesich
